title: Living Outside the Frame: Making an Idol of Art & Genius Led to a Loss of Meaning and then to Christ
description:
Links mentioned are at the end of the notes.
Paul Gordon Collier's childhood was one of difficulty pain and frequent dislocation, always living just outside the frame that others inhabited, but ultimately, that is what prepared him for the life he now leads. In 2001, he went from being a militant atheist to a believer in Jesus Christ.

Along the way, he fell in love with the work of Sylvia Plath, Curt Schwitters, Marcel Duchamps, Matta and John Keats.
We talk about how easy it is to make an idol of intellect, genius, art and driven goals.  Memorable quotes:
"The utility of the bowl is in the empty space." Lao Tsu
What's not said gives the viewer the opportunity to enter in.
"Negative capability" - John Keats
Chaos is where the unexpected connections happen, things you
couldn't plan out.
At the foot of the cross, we learn the fear of the Lord and the devastating consequences of our sin, all of which He took upon Himself. From the resurrection and the empty tomb, we learn the love of the Lord.
The life of Job prepares us for times of persecution, for we see that suffering is bearable because Christ is our life, He has already given us everything we need.

Karen's conversations with Paul VanderKlay:
First: (this is the conversation in which I lay out my vision of the how the world works)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HlMgGkwWUNY
Second: (This is where I tell the story of my life)
https://youtu.be/ZC03aNsPHOQ
Karen's interview with Mary Kochan on the Elements and Principles mentioned in the first video with Paul.
https://youtu.be/rdjfxPnHqZs

Art and Fear by Orland and Bayles - highly recommend this book!
